data.title: A Guide to Health & Safety in the Workplace
data.meta_description: Dundee and Angus Chamber of Commerce are here to help businesses. Access training and events from DACC.
data.text:
What will Social Distancing mean to you and your organisation? What measures will you have to put in place and how will this impact your workforce? Our speakers will help guide businesses to ensure a safe working environment when restrictions start to be lifted as we hear from Dover Fueling Solutions EMEA Safety, Health and Environmental Manager, Mark Husband, and Alexander's Community Development Founder & Centre Manager, John Alexander & Kara Swankie.

ONLINE REGISTRATION FOR THE EVENT IS NOW CLOSED, SHOULD YOU WISH TO ATTEND PLEASE CLICK ON THE BELOW TEAMS WEBINAR LINK AND JOIN US ONLINE FROM 6.30PM.

Join Microsoft Teams Meeting

Speakers

Mark Husband, EMEA Safety, Health and Environmental Manager for Dover Fueling Solutions.

Mark has been a safety professional for over 10 years in the downstream fuel industry. After graduating with a BA in International Business Management & French from Abertay University, Mark started his career at Tokheim service & sales division, firstly in marketing and sales before achieving his NEBOSH qualification and becoming the H&S Manager for the UK and Ireland. In 2014 Mark moved into a dual role managing H&S for the Tokheim Global Key Accounts and new business projects around the emerging future fuels markets. Once Tokheim was acquired by Dover Corporation in 2015, becoming Dover Fueling Solutions (DFS), Mark became EMEA safety lead, accountable for safety in all DFS sites in EMEA region as well as product safety of the installed base. Mark was one of the first qualified Mental Health First Aiders in DFS and is also a member of the Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (IOSH).

John Alexander – Founder, Managing Director and Lead Trainer

John is the face of Alexander Communtiy Development and shares his passion for upskilling and developing people to everyone he meets. His vision for a training centre, came to fruition in 2019, when he founded Alexander Community Development.

Following a career of over 20 years running a Painting and Decorating business, John found the niche in the market for a training centre in the city. Supporting over 100 young people, so far, and with continually growing team, John will be at the helm of delivering training across Alexander Community Development and Alexander’s Training.

With a background in lecturing, training as well as real life experience, John is perfectly placed to lead all training programmes, with a particular interest in running the bespoke programme for young people in schools.

In 2020, along side continuously pushing the vision for Alexander Community Development, John and his training team will expand into Health and Safety and specialised sanitization spraying, a unique offering to the city.

Kara Swankie - Centre Manager

Kara is known for getting the job done, and getting it done right, first time...every time!

Working closely with John Alexander, Kara will drive the development of Alexander Community Development and Alexander’s Training, delivering a unique training outlet for Tayside and North East Scotland. This includes project managing the build of a new centre on the existing site as well as creating the programme offerings.

Kara previously founded and sold, not just one, but two start-up businesses which jump-started her successful career in project management.

Following on from Kara’s exit from her second start up business, Kara then created and delivered a business accelerator training programme.

It was through this initiative that Kara met John Alexander, who shared with her his vision for Alexander’s Training.

About Alexander Community Development

Alexander Community Development is a community driven non-profit training centre based in Dundee, which provides a 3-tiered system to upskill and develop the people of Dundee.

Alexander Community Development has developed from 20 years of work in the decorating trade, both in practise and education. The sister company of ACD, Alexander Decorators LTD has lead the way in developing skill and talent in the trade, and this work will now be built upon in ACD.

We will be doing a Q&A session after hearing from our speakers, however should you have any questions you know you would like to ask please send them to Sarah Youngsarahyoung@dundeeandanguschamber.co.uk by 5pm on Tuesday 12 May.
